result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court sets restitution at $0.
Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 3-14-2017; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 3-14-17; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive with to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  
Court ordered the first 4 months of sentence to be done straight time; remaining balance through the Day Reporting Center with release for AODA treatment and job training.  No work release and no electronic monitoring.
Court ordered AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking behavioral Modification Program.
No contact with Porscha P.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Clayton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for electronic monitoring.

Court signed order Denying defendant's request for additional release privileges . The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence withou work release privileges. The court also denies the request for the sentence to be served on electronic monitoring as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.  Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for work release and electronic monitoring.

Defendant James E Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive with to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  Court ordered the first 4 months of sentence to be done straight time; remaining balance through the Day Reporting Center with release for AODA treatment and job training.  No work release and no electronic monitoring.
-Court ordered AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Proscha P.
-Court sets restitution at $0
-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 3-14-2017; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 3-14-17; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Defendant James E Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant James E Clayton not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Opland-Dobs ill and unable to appear.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James E Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James E Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Jury trial date of 6-10-15 to stand until plea entered.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James E Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Brittnay Kachingwe for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond that he signed in the jail continues.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Porscha P., and her residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James E Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/15 @ 1:30 pm
